author: Aylin Woodward
title: Healthcare workers can carry coronavirus particles on their shoes, new CDC research shows
description: The coronavirus typically spreads via airborne droplets from an infected person's coughs or sneezes. But viral particles can survive for a time on surfaces — between three hours and seven days, depending on the material. New research suggests the coronavirus …
content:
The new coronavirus causes a respiratory illness, so it typically spreads via airborne droplets. When an infected person coughs or sneezes, droplets carrying viral particles can land on someone else's nose or mouth or get inhaled.
But a person can also get t… [+3998 chars]
